task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and the goal outline, approach and align, then execute a coarse and a fine push to seat the block into the goal before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed tabletop scene shows a robot with a circular end-effector pushing a T-shaped block toward a drawn goal outline. The behavior requires reliable perception of both the block and the target, precise approach, orientation setting, and a two-stage push (coarse then fine) to achieve final placement. Movements should remain planar, with brief dwell and retreat after success. The dataset runs at 10 Hz observation/control, implying short timeouts and reactive updates.
preconditions: Camera view contains both block and goal outline
stepwise_plan: Move above block and align to its face
Refine with a short push to seat the part
success_criteria: Block pose matches goal outline within visual tolerance
failure_and_recovery: If misalignment occurs, realign and retry fine push
If timeout during push, back off and re-approach
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after successful placement check and retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Raster scan to localize the T-block.
Detect and confirm the goal outline.
Position TCP above block at safe height.
Align end-effector normal to pushing face.
Refine alignment relative to goal outline.
Short fine push to seat the block.

failure_modes: Push direction wrong due to orientation error
recovery_strategy: Re-run ApproachAndAlign then repeat fine Push
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue goal outline; instruction colors (gray block, green target, blue end-effector) differ. We followed the frames.
Push direction assumed 90° in image plane toward the goal outline.
10 Hz rates inform short timeouts but are not explicit ports in the node library.

expected_success_criteria: Block visually overlaps the goal outline within small tolerance (≈0.5–1 cm)
